intro: Trichodesma calcaratum, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its seeds are enclosed in a hairy pod, and it plays a role in nitrogen fixation due to its symbiotic relationship with rhizobia. Trichodesma calcaratum is often found in coastal and inland regions, contributing to local biodiversity.
